paper.title: Forecasting Turkish real GDP growth in a data-rich environment
paper.abstract: This study generates nowcasts and forecasts for the growth rate of the gross domestic product in Turkey using 204 daily financial series with mixed data sampling (MIDAS) framework. The daily financial series include commodity prices, equity indices, exchange rates, and global and domestic corporate risk series. Forecasting exercises are also carried out with the daily factors extracted from separate financial data classes and from the whole dataset. The findings of the study suggest that MIDAS regression models and forecast combinations provide advantage in exploiting information from daily financial data compared to the models using simple aggregation schemes. In addition, incorporating daily financial data into the analysis improves the forecasts substantially. These results indicate that both the information content of the financial data and the flexible data-driven weighting scheme of MIDAS regressions play an essential role in forecasting the future state of the Turkish economy.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究使用混合数据抽样（MIDAS）框架和回归模型来预测土耳其的实际GDP增长，虽然涉及金融数据（如商品价格、股票指数、汇率等），但其核心应用是宏观经济预测，而非衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等特定金融领域。
